chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type
p: X * Y -> Prop

Goal:
enumerable p -> enumerable (fun y : Y => exists x : X, p (x, y))

Premises:
enumerable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : nat -> option X, enumerator f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments enumerable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
projection : forall (X Y : Type) (p : X * Y -> Prop), enumerable p -> enumerable (fun x : X => exists y : Y, p (x, y))
enumerable_conj : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> Prop), discrete X -> enumerable p -> enumerable q -> enumerable (fun x : X => p x /\ q x)
ssrfun.tagged2 : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?T_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- Type] ?T_ : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- ?I -> Type]
ssrfun.tagged2' : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?U_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- Type] ?T_ : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- ?I -> Type]
dec_count_enum' : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> enumerable__T X -> enumerable (fun x : X => ~ p x)
In_cumul : forall (L : nat -> list ?X) (x : ?X) (n : nat), x el cumul L n -> exists n0 : nat, x el L n0 where ?X : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- Type]
ssrfun.Tagged : forall T_ : ?I -> Type, T_ ?i -> {x0 : ?I & T_ x0} where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- Type] ?i : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- ?I]
VectorSpec.uncons_cons : forall (a : ?A) (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n), VectorDef.uncons (VectorDef.cons ?A a ?n v) = (a, v) where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- Type] ?n : [X : Type Y : Type p : X * Y -> Prop |- nat]
prod_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X * Y
Relation_Operators.symprod_sind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A * B -> A * B -> SProp), (forall x x' : A, leA x x' -> forall y : B, P (x, y) (x', y)) -> (forall y y' : B, leB y y' -> forall x : A, P (x, y) (x, y')) -> forall p p0 : A * B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB p p0 -> P p p0
Relation_Operators.symprod_ind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A * B -> A * B -> Prop), (forall x x' : A, leA x x' -> forall y : B, P (x, y) (x', y)) -> (forall y y' : B, leB y y' -> forall x : A, P (x, y) (x, y')) -> forall p p0 : A * B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB p p0 -> P p p0
enumerable_semi_decidable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : discrete X) => match H with | ex_intro _ d Hd => fun H0 : exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, p x < ->...-> semi_decidable p Arguments enumerable_semi_decidable {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
dec_count_enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : decidable p) => let H0 : semi_decidable p := decidable_semi_decidable H in fun H1 : enumerable__T X => semi_decidable_enumerable H1 H0 : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> enumerable__T X -> enumerable p Arguments dec_count_enum {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
enumerable_list_enumerable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : enumerable p) => match H with | ex_intro _ f Hf => ex_intro (fun L : nat -> list X => list_enumerator L p) (fun n : nat => match f n with | Some x => [x] | None => [] end) (fun x : X => (fun lemma : (exists n : nat, f n = Some x) <-> (exists n : nat, x el (fun n0 : nat => match f n0 with | Some x0 => [x0] | None => [] end) n) => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER RelationClasses.iff_equivalence) (exists m : nat, x el (fun n : nat => match f n with | Some x0 => [x0] | None => [] end) m) (exists n : nat, f n = Some x) (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma)) (enumerator_to_list_enumerator X f...
list_enumerable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) => exists L : nat -> list X, list_enumerator L p : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments list_enumerable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
prod_enum = fun (X Y : Type) (f1 : nat -> option X) (f2 : nat -> option Y) (n : nat) => let (n0, m) := unembed n in let (o, o0) := (f1 n0, f2 m) in match o with | Some x => match o0 with | Some y => Some (x, y) | None => None end | None => None end : forall X Y : Type, (nat -> option X) -> (nat -> option Y) -> nat -> option (X * Y) Arguments prod_enum {X Y}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope _%nat_scope
list_enumerable_enumerable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : list_enumerable p) => match H with | ex_intro _ T HT => ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option X => enumerator f p) (fun n : nat => let (n0, m) := unembed n in nth_error (T n0) m) (fun x : X => (fun lemma : (exists n : nat, (fun n0 : nat => let (n1, m) := unembed n0 in nth_error (T n1) m) n = Some x) <-> (exists n : nat, x el T n) => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER RelationClasses.iff_equivalence) (exists n : nat, (fun n0 : nat => let (n1, m) := unembed n0 in nth_error (T n1) m) n = Some x) (exists n : nat, x el T n) lemma) (list...
dec_compl : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p -> decidable (fun x : X => ~ p x)
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinPosDef.Pos.add y (BinNums.xO (mul p y)) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xO (mul p y) | BinNums.xH => y end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
enumerable_enumerable_T : forall X : Type, enumerable (fun _ : X => True) < -> enumerable__T X
decidable_semi_decidable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H0 : decidable p) => match H0 with | ex_intro _ f H => ex_intro (fun f0 : X -> nat -> bool => semi_decider f0 p) (fun (x : X) (_ : nat) => f x) (fun x : X => (fun lemma : p x <-> f x = true => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (p x) (f x = true) lemma (exists _ : nat, f x = true) (exists _ : nat, f x = true) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists _ : nat, f x = true))) (H x) (conj (fun H1 : f x = true => let H2 := 0 in (fun H3 : nat => ex_intro (fun _ : nat => f x = true) H3 H1) H2) (fun H1 : exists _ : nat, f x =...
Relation_Operators.swapprod_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : A * A -> A * A -> SProp), (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> P (x, y) p) -> (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> P (y, x) p) -> forall p p0 : A * A, Relation_Operators.swapprod A R p p0 -> P p p0
Relation_Operators.swapprod_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : A * A -> A * A -> Prop), (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> P (x, y) p) -> (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> P (y, x) p) -> forall p p0 : A * A, Relation_Operators.swapprod A R p p0 -> P p p0
Inductive swapprod (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) : A * A -> A * A -> Prop := sp_noswap : forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (x, y) p | sp_swap : forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (y, x) p Arguments Relation_Operators.swapprod _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.sp_noswap _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.sp_swap _%type_scope _%function_scope
Relation_Operators.sp_noswap : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (x, y) p
enumerable__T = fun X : Type => exists f : nat -> option X, enumerator__T f X : Type -> Prop Arguments enumerable__T _%type_scope
list_enumerator = fun (X : Type) (L : nat -> list X) (p : X -> Prop) => forall x : X, p x < -> (exists m : nat, x el L m) : forall X : Type, (nat -> list X) -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments list_enumerator {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
cumul_spec = fun (X : Type) (L : nat -> list X) (p : X -> Prop) (H : forall x : X, p x <-> (exists m : nat, x el L m)) (x : X) => (fun lemma : (exists n : nat, x el L n) <-> (exists n : nat, x el cumul L n) => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER RelationClasses.iff_equivalence) (exists m : nat, x el cumul L m) (exists n : nat, x el L n) (RelationClasses.symmetry lemma)) (to_cumul_spec L x) (H x) : forall (X : Type) (L : nat -> list X) (p : X -> Prop), list_enumerator L p -> list_enumerator (cumul L) p Arguments cumul_spec {X}%type_scope {L p}%function_scope
Relation_Operators.sp_swap : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> Relation_Operators.swapprod A R (y, x) p
semi_decidable_enumerable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (H : enumerable__T X) => match H with | ex_intro _ e He => fun H0 : exists f : X -> nat -> bool, forall x : X, p x < ->...-> enumerable p Arguments semi_decidable_enumerable {X}%type_scope {p}%function_scope
